name: Golden nematode- Globodera rostochiensis
description: The adult Brown Marmorated Stink Bug is about 3/4 inch in length and feeds on a wide variety of plants including fruit trees, vegetable crops, and ornamentals.
hosts: Known Hosts: Potatoes (Solanum spp.), tomatoes (Lycopersicum esculentum), eggplant (S. melogena), and some solanaceous weeds (e.g. nightshade).
appearance: Patches of poor growth with yellowing or wilting of foliage.
With a heavy infestation the cysts are visible on the roots with the naked eye.
Cysts are the hardened body of the female nematode swollen with eggs. They are spherical in shape and attached to the root by a stalk (the head and neck of the female).
Cysts start out white then turn a golden yellow color and finally turn brown.
